isis.stitle: 3300 HOOD, GRILLE, FENDERS AND BUMPER - REMOVE - HOOD

step1.para: Prior to removing the hood and related components, the bumper and grille / shroud assembly ( Figure 31) should be removed.

Hood latches, each side of the hood, should have been previously released. Tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the hood cable stop assemblies.
Prior to hood removal, the bumper should have already been removed with all pertinent harness connections disconnected.

If the chassis is equipped with heated cross-view mirrors, the mirror heater ( Figure 21, Item 4) connection harness must be disconnected each side. Recheck all harness connections. The hood harness stays with the hood assembly when hood is removed.
With the grille / shroud assembly removed and the hood tilted, locate the hood cable stops and attachment brackets on each side of the radiator top frame ( Figure 23, Item 2) .

figure.caption: Figure 23. Radiator Top Frame And Cable Stop Assemblies

step1.para: Locate the retaining pin ( Figure 24, Item 4) and the clevis ( Figure 23, Item 5) on the radiator top frame brackets ( Figure 24, Item 5).
Remove the retaining pin ( Figure 25, Item 3) from the clevis ( Figure 25, Item 2) and radiator top ( Figure 25, Item 4) frame clevis bracket.

figure.caption: Figure 25. Retaining Pin and Clevis Removal

step1.para: Follow the same procedure for the opposite side cable stop assembly.

para.emph: Removal of the torsion bars is easily accessible through the grille area which should have been previously removed.

step1.para: The torsion bar assemblies assist in the amount of pull required to open the hood assembly. Torsion bars are attached at each side of the hood, and to the opposite side at the frame. The driver side or (street side) torsion bar is mounted in the passenger side hood bracket and held in place by a retainer clip. This torsion bar drops down and crosses the front of the chassis above the hood hinge assembly. The torsion bar is then inserted into the frame rail retainer bracket and is locked in place with a retainer clip. The passenger side torsion bar is a larger diameter (12.5 mm diameter) and is generally the first to be removed and the last to be replaced. This torsion bar is mounted in the hood bracket on the driver side of the hood assembly ( Figure 27, Item 3. This bar drops down and crosses the front of the chassis over the hinge assembly and over the opposite torsion bar ( Figure 26, Item 3) to the passenger side (curb side) of the chassis. This torsion bar then ends in the passenger side frame mounted torsion bar retention bracket ( Figure 28, Item 5). It is locked in place with a retainer clip ( Figure 28, Item 6).
Locate the 12.5mm torsion bar hood mounting bracket ( Figure 27, Item 3) on the driver side of the hood assembly. Remove the retainer clip ( Figure 27, Item 2).
With an assistant, partially close hood to relieve tension on the torsion bar. Remove the torsion bar end from the hood mounting bracket.
Remove the retainer clip from the 12.5mm torsion bar ( Figure 75, Item 4) on the passenger side of the frame rail mounting bracket ( Figure 75, Item 5).
Lift the torsion bar out of the frame rail mounting bracket and alignment guide.
Place torsion bar in an out of the way location.

figure.caption: Figure 27. Upper Hood Torsion Bar Retaining Clip and Bracket

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. UPPER DRIVER SIDE TORSION BAR MOUNTING BRACKET BOLTS

step1.para: Locate the remaining torsion bar (passenger side) upper hood mounting bracket ( Figure 75, Item 2). Remove the retainer clip ( Figure 75, Item 1) securing the torsion bar in the hood mounting bracket.

figure.caption: Figure 28. Torsion Bar Lower Bracket and Retaining Clip (Passenger Side Shown)

step1.para: With an assistant, partially close hood to relieve tension on the torsion bar. Remove the torsion bar end from the hood mounting bracket.
Remove the retainer clip ( Figure 75, Item 8) on the driver side frame rail retention bracket ( Figure 75, Item 7).
Lift and remove torsion bar from bracket and guide and place with the other torsion bar bracket.

Check the torsion bar, if the passenger side torsion bar is first to be removed, note that the diameter of the torsion bar is larger than the opposite side torsion bar. This bar must be placed back on the same side as it was removed from.
With the hood still in the open position, locate the hinge plate hex head mounting bolts ( Figure 29, Item 5),
Mark or scribe the position of the hood hinge on the hood hinge mounting plate before closing hood.
Loosen and but do not remove the hood hinge plate mounting bolts ( Figure 29, Item 5).
With an assistant close the hood assembly.
With the same assistant, lift and remove hood assembly ( Figure 30).
Place the hood assembly on a flat, secure, padded area to protect from scratching or damaging the paint on the hood assembly.
